column4: Wisconsin
column6: WI

column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. Collisions can happen more often when:
column4: one vehicle is traveling faster than the flow of traffic.
column6: all vehicles are traveling at the posted speed limit.
column8: one lane of traffic is traveling faster than the others.

column2: 2. Which statement about driving and drugs is true?
column4: Prescription drugs are safe to use if they don't make you feel drowsy.
column6: Only illegals drugs can impair your driving.
column8: Even over the counter drugs can impair your driving.

column4: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
column6: Divided highway ahead.

column2: 4. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.
column6: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.

column4: No right turn
column6: No U-turns

column2: 6. After you stop for a school bus, you must:
column4: turn off your engine.
column6: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.
column8: wait until the red lights stop flashing.

column4: take longer to stop than passenger vehicles.
column6: have high-tech air brakes which allow them to stop quickly.
column8: are more maneuverable than passenger vehicles.

column2: 8. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.
column6: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.
column8: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.

column4: drive at a constant speed.
column6: apply the brakes firmly.

column2: 10. Before applying for a probationary license, the minimum number of driving hours an applicant under 18 must obtain is:
column4: 30 hours total with 10 at night.
column6: 40 hours total with 10 at night.

column2: 11. Drive below the posted speed limit when:
column4: entering a highway where there are other cars.
column6: anything makes conditions less than perfect.
column8: you are on a four lane road.
column10: others drive below the speed limit.

column2: 12. After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane when:
column4: the driver you passed slows down to let you return to your lane.
column6: you have put your turn signal on.
column8: you are at least 100 feet ahead of the vehicle you passed.
column10: you can see both headlights of the vehicle you just passed in your rearview mirror.

column4: School zone
column6: Work zone ahead

column2: 14. When in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:
column4: acceptable to drink alcoholic beverages if you are not driving.
column6: permissible to drink a moderate amount of alcohol when driving with a passenger.
column8: illegal to drink from, but permissible to transport, open containers of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column10: illegal to possess an open container of alcohol in the passenger compartment.

column4: This lane is reserved for bicyclists
column6: Bicycle crossing

column2: 16. If you've had a few beers, the effects of alcohol will be reduced only by:
column4: getting a cup of coffee.
column6: waiting several hours.

column2: 17. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
column4: A police officer.
column6: A flashing red light.

column4: makes it easier to make correct decisions.
column6: makes you less aware of what is happening to your driving abilities.
column8: enhances your ability to see clearly.

column4: Keep left
column6: Curves ahead

column2: 20. Continuous hard braking on ice and snow often:
column4: is the best option during winter.
column6: causes the front wheels to lock.

column2: 21. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: slow down and keep well to the left.
column6: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
column10: slow down and keep well to the right.

column4: Merging traffic
column6: Slippery when wet

column2: 23. If a pedestrian is in the middle of the street when your signal light changes to green, you should:
column4: proceed because you have the right-of-way.
column6: proceed unless the pedestrian is in your lane.
column8: wait until the pedestrian crosses the street before proceeding.

column2: 24. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column4: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.
column6: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.
column10: Wait for the next green light.

column2: 25. When a traffic signal light turns green, you should:
column4: wait 5 seconds before proceeding.
column6: back up slowly.
column10: yield the right-of-way to larger vehicles.

column4: Keep to the side indicated by the arrow
column6: Stop sign ahead

column4: Traffic from all four directions must stop.
column6: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.
column8: There are four stop signs at the intersection.

column2: 28. To check your blind spot before changing lanes:
column4: look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move.
column6: look into the rearview mirror.
column8: look into the left side mirror.
column10: look into the right side mirror.

column2: 29. Don't be afraid to sound a sharp blast on your horn when:
column4: you have lost control of your vehicle and are moving towards someone.
column6: when a child is about to run into the street.
column8: another vehicle is in danger of hitting you.

column4: is distracting.
column6: is not distracting.

column4: Stop ahead
column6: Buggy warning

column4: U-turns are not allowed.
column6: Parking is not allowed.

column4: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column6: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.

column4: One-way traffic
column6: Divided highway ends
column10: Keep right, traffic is entering from another road.

column2: 35. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: the maneuver shown on the sign can be executed only after coming to a complete stop.
column6: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.
column8: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.
column10: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.

column4: an area designated for blind persons.
column6: the area where pedestrians may cross the road.

column2: 37. Directions given by traffic officers ___________ signs, signals or pavement markings.
column4: never take precedence over
column6: take precedence over

column2: 38. Following another vehicle too closely is known as:
column4: closetailing.
column6: tailgating.

column2: 39. What is the meaning of red traffic signs?
column4: High emphasis warning.
column6: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.

column2: 40. The use of alcohol and/or drugs affects:
column4: alertness and judgement.
column6: concentration and reaction time.

column4: give the right-of-way to traffic on the road they wish to enter.
column6: come to a complete stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding.
column8: proceed at normal speed through the upcoming intersection.

column4: pass within 250 feet of any intersection.
column6: exceed the posted speed limit when passing.
column8: pass within 150 feet of any railroad crossing.

column4: Sharp left turns ahead, in both directions.
column6: The center lane in both directions of travel will soon turn left.
column8: The center lane is shared for left turns in both directions of travel.
column10: Vehicles may only travel in the center lane.

column4: Drivers must turn right
column6: Right turn permitted on red light

column4: decrease as vehicle speed increases.
column6: increase as vehicle speed increases.
column8: are not affected by vehicle speed.

column2: 46. You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:
column4: pay close attention to the turn signals.
column6: cut abruptly in front of it.
column10: pull in front of the large vehicle before you can see the whole front of the vehicle in your mirror.

column2: 47. If a vehicle is approaching with high beams, drivers should look __________ until the vehicle passes.
column4: at the center of the road
column6: straight ahead
column8: to the left of the road
column10: to the right of the road

column4: anticipate errors by other drivers.
column6: not check behind you through your mirrors.
column8: assume that a driver who approaches a STOP sign on a side road is actually going to stop.
column10: use only one hand on the wheel.

column4: diamond-shaped.
column6: triangles.

column4: must be ignored in snow conditions.
column6: shows the recommended speed for a curve/turn.
